12.6.24  1:49 pm   I remember seeing the script for "2 friends on the beach" but now I can't find it. Do you know where I may have seen it?

here
2 friends, on the beach.


are we friends?   yes

(becomes a picture, in a very high class gallery. 2 ppl looking at it)


f1: 'mm ....   that's a very good picture '
f2: 'yea'

i'm gonna buy it.  (wanders over to the sales podium,)  'i think i'm gonna take the friendship picture.'
(woman at podium, soft, gentle hushed voice of upper class) 'ok'

(the 2 guys wander out)

f1  'thanks for coming with me, i always buy terrible pictures, unless you're here, then i buy the good ones.'
f2   'aw, that's sweet'
they get in the car. there is only 1 big button in the car. it says 'go somewhere'

it drives extremely quickly, almost instantaneously, to the fields of ohio.


f1  'you know one of the great things about that picture gallery place, is, they have airconditioning but you can never actually feel the air blowing.'

'i felt it'
'no you didnt'
(admittedly)'yea no, i didn't', i just wanted to see if you were actually invested in the conversation
(laughs) 'hahahahahahahahahahaha let's go out to dinner'
is that what we had planned?
yes but i planned it again just to make sure
'
[extremely quickly arrive at the restaurant. it looks like a .... quaint /shady motel? diner?]
it's called 'curtains restaurant'. there are curtains in the window


'This place is really good, it's like one of the top rated places'
  'ooooh'

(they get in)

(quietly and slightly mischeivously, but not too mischeivous)'should we go in the lobster section?'
  i ..can't handle that right now.,,,
'ok, let's just sit on the roof'

(very immediately, they end up on the roof, perched impossibly... perhaps directly on top of the chimney)

(the scene happens for a couple seconds)


f1  'so how's your familly'
f2   'i have 2 families'
f1 'how's the better one'
f2   'pretty good'
'f1 i have zero families'
f2  'how's that one'
'f1  it's ok'
f2   'i'm sorry to hear that'


f1  do you think i would look good with huge muscles
-- '....eh.....'
  
-- ' .... as long as they're not as big as planet earth'
--('ok')
-- '.... that's a good guideline to go by'

(waiter has come upthe stairs to fill the waters, and hears them talking)
'hey, are you guys friends?'
-- f1:'nah, we're business coworkers'
f2.. [sly smirk, looking across to f1]  'maybe...'
waiter:  'ok. .. Let me know if you want to go in the lobster section, i just had some tables open up'
  f2: 'yeah, ok thanks' (ALMOST sarcastically, but not )

(brief pause), (dinner mood,etc)

f1, quietly, maybe leaning closer: 'how much was that picture i bought earlier?'
f2: 'you mean the price'
f1; 'yea'
f2........................... 'i think about 12 million'
f1: (interested/slightly intrigued) 'Really.'
f2... i think that's what it said.
f1 (not annoyed, just thinking about it, interestedly)...... 'hmh'....
f2 ...  cuz, you figure it's got 2 people in it.
f1.... 'oh right, 6 million for each person'
f2 .... 'that's what i'm thinkin'
f2... 'do you even have that much money?'
f1,  'i'll probably dig a hole somehwere, and find it there
f2 'true'

waiter (comes up stairs)   "ok, so we have ................................... corn" (instantly and casually dumps a bunch of corn onto their plates/table)

f1: "ah, that's fantastic, thanks." (f2 nodding)
waiter: "and i'll be back, i'll bring you a bunch of forks"

f1: "ok" f2: "thanks

f2: just think about, how many restaurants we Could have gone to.
f1: yeah..
f2: how many do you think we could have gone to?
f1: just 1. this is the only one that still serves food.

f2: right ok, i understand that, but, think of this.... [glances briefly to side, as if to casually check if anyone else is listening. not too secretively, just slightly casual side glance]............ how many restaurants are actually a different restaurant?
1:  ...... (pause, blink,... ambiguously we can't tell if he's thinking f2 is crazy or if he's just patiently listening)




f2like, let's say you're driving along, lo de da de doo, [f1: right]  minding you're own business, and you're about get to the restaurant, and then you're there, and bam, it's a different restaurant.
f1:  .......... yep
f2: forever, it's been.
f1:  i understand
f2, like, it changed, but like it already had changed. like a long time ago.
f1:.................................................................................right right right,   yeah, i get it
f2: like a bait and switch
f1: uh huh.

f2: how often tdo you think that happens?
f1: i think it happens constantly.
f2: you think,
f1: best thing about the restaurant biz, .... just the   fluidity.



--

--f1        right
--right there, in that moment, ........  at that particular time,

--f2: so, just, let me understand something:  in the entire city, well, i guess, in this entire district, ........
--f1:  yeah......
--f2:   how many times has someone gone to a restaurant, thinking they were going to a different restaurant, ......
--f1: ........ "but then it changed"
f2: but then that restaurant changed into a different restaurant--
--f1: yea
--f2: before they got there --- you see what i'm saying
--f1: yes

--f1: i think that happens constantly.
--f2: really
-- f1: best thing about the restaurant biz, .... just the   fluidity.

(flump)   [29 pack of forks falls on the table from above]

f1: "ah, here's the forks. it's a 29 pack. how many would you like?"
f2: "i'll take all 29.  how many would you like"
f1: "just 1, and i'll maybe use the back of it"
f2: "that's fair"  (dumps the forks on the table)

f2 begins eating corn, f1 is just bumping it around with the back of a fork.  this goes on for about 7 sec




waiter "hey folks, time for desert?"
f1, f2  in unison  "no way"

waiter "ok, thanks for keeping me informed"



pause


f2: "the world's not ending tomorrow, right?"
f1: "no"


f2: "nice"

f1: (nodding, eating)

f2: what do you think we should do

f1:........... we could buy another painting

f2: that sounds lovely, except i don't like paintings.

f1: oh really? what don't you like about them

f2: they're not real

f1. ah, that's true. ....... maybe we should go to the beach

f2: realizing "ahhhhhhhhhhh"


[cut to them on the beach , with relaxing music to close the video]

[end]

12.6.24  12:17 pm   I saw this form of musical notation in a question asked to you on August 14, 2018: "3/4

3..45./2...../1..23./lo7...../lo6.lo7.1./lo5...3./4..321/2...../
3..45./2...../1..23./lo7...3./4.3.1./1...lo7./1.1235/8.1.../"; you mentioned in your answer that this is a form of notation you use as well when you only have access to text to write music.
It looks interesting and efficient, but I can't make heads or tails of it. Would you mind explaining this form of notation, to a musician-in-training who's used to standard music notation?
